intro: Hordeum muticum, commonly known as sea barley, is a species of grass that thrives in coastal and saline environments. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and small, spikelet-bearing inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or muddy soils along shorelines, demonstrating a high tolerance for salt and wind exposure. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand harsh maritime conditions. Hordeum muticum plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various small organisms.
